Class ButtonDisplay

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Widget
      • org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Control
        • org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Scrollable
          • org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Composite
            • org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Canvas
              • view.ButtonDisplay
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    org.eclipse.swt.graphics.Drawable

    public class ButtonDisplay
extends org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Canvas

    ButtonDisplay

    A custom widget for buttons in program. Contains an image and text.

    Author:
    Valentina Munoz & Moris Amon

    • Method Detail

      • initWidgets

        private void initWidgets(java.lang.String txt)

        initWidgets

        Create the widgets inside de button. The button contains two labels, one for the image and one for the text.

        Parameters:
        txt - text of button

      • drawBtn

        private void drawBtn(int width,
                     int height,
                     org.eclipse.swt.graphics.Point size)

        drawBtn

        Change button (labels) position to be at the center. Also, if button should be disable, change image and text color.

        Parameters:
        width - bg image width
        height - bg image height
        size - text size

      • setLabel

        private void setLabel(java.lang.String txt)

        setLabel

        Create the button text label and change it font size.

        Parameters:
        txt - text of button

        public void setMouseListener(org.eclipse.swt.events.MouseListener mouseListener)

        setMouseListener

        Get a mouse listener, and add it to each label in button

        Parameters:
        mouseListener - mouse listener to add to button
